jtxt.emulator

Class Terminal

  • java.lang.Object
    • jtxt.emulator.Terminal
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ComponentObserver

    public class Terminal
extends java.lang.Object
implements ComponentObserver
    A class for displaying TUI Components on the screen. Components which are interactive may use this class to receive input from the mouse and keyboard.

    This is not a real terminal, and does not expose the underlying system's command interface. The aim of this class is to present Components as if they are being displayed in a terminal. It should be noted then that an application started from the system command line will open a new window in which it will be displayed.

    Before Components can be added to an instance of this class, the terminal must be initialized with a Layout for the RootContainer. This RootContainer is a Container at the top of the Component hierarchy in the terminal (meaning that all Components displayed in a terminal window are an ancestor of this Container in the Component tree). A typical instantiation of a terminal might look something like this: 

      Terminal terminal = new Terminal.Builder()
                                  // ...
                                  .dimensions(40, 40)
                                  .build();
  terminal.createRootContainer(new ALayoutOfSomeKind());
  // Create some Components here...
  terminal.add(component1,
               component2,
               component3);
    Note that Components (including other Containers) can be added at any time to the interface, and this interface will update automatically. Nothing needs to be done on the client-side, aside from initializing the terminal, creating the Components, and adding them to the terminal (where they will be direct children of the RootContainer) or adding them to another Container which has been added to the terminal.

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected Context context
      Holds general information regarding the settings of this instance of the terminal.
      private EventDispatcher dispatcher
      Handles all events that may occur at random (and unpredictable) times within the terminal.

      The current component receiving key events.
      private Prompt prompt
      The prompt handles all user-input in the terminal.

      Uses the given render settings to rasterize and display frames in the window.
      protected RootContainer root
      The root container that all components that appear in the terminal belong to.
      protected javax.swing.JFrame window
      The window for displaying the buffer to the screen.

    • Field Detail

      • context

        protected Context context
        Holds general information regarding the settings of this instance of the terminal.

      • window

        protected javax.swing.JFrame window
        The window for displaying the buffer to the screen. Used for Java2D abstraction over the text-based application.
        See Also:
        BufferedFrame

      • renderer

        private Renderer renderer
        Uses the given render settings to rasterize and display frames in the window.

      • prompt

        private Prompt prompt
        The prompt handles all user-input in the terminal. Separate from the text-area, this object fetches and parses input. There should only be one prompt per instance of a Terminal.
        See Also:
        requestInput(String)

      • root

        protected RootContainer root
        The root container that all components that appear in the terminal belong to. Components that are not added to another container will be direct ancestors of this container.
        See Also:
        add(Component[])

      • dispatcher

        private EventDispatcher dispatcher
        Handles all events that may occur at random (and unpredictable) times within the terminal. These events are usually user-generated.

      • focused

        protected KeyboardTarget focused
        The current component receiving key events.
        See Also:
        focus(KeyboardTarget), focusAt(Location)

    • Constructor Detail

      • Terminal

        public Terminal(Context context,
                java.lang.String title,
                java.awt.Color background,
                float transparency,
                Renderer.RasterType rasterType)
        Creates a new instance of Terminal based on the given Context's properties.
        Parameters:
        context - The setting information for the terminal.
        title - The title of the terminal window.
        background - The color of the background which appears being the text.
        transparency - A normalized value between zero and one, which will determine how much of the screen is visible behind the window, as well as the visibility of the text.
        rasterType - The type of rasterizer to use for rendering text to the window. This should not make much noticeable difference in appearance, though it may impact performance of an application.

    • Method Detail

      • getContext

        public Context getContext()

      • createRootContainer

        public RootContainer createRootContainer(Layout layout)
        Constructs and returns a new RootContainer using this terminal as the context, and the given layout as the super layout of all Components within the terminal.
        Parameters:
        layout - The layout to use for placing Components within this terminal.
        Returns:
        A new RootContainer which has been constructed for this terminal with the given layout.

      • getRoot

        public RootContainer getRoot()
        Gets the root container, which is the parent of all components within the terminal.
        Returns:
        The root container of this terminal.

      • focusAt

        public void focusAt(Location location)
        Focuses the component at the given location, and makes it the target for key events.
        Parameters:

      • getFocusedComponent

        public KeyboardTarget getFocusedComponent()

      • clickComponent

        protected void clickComponent(Location location)

      • requestInput

        public java.lang.String requestInput(java.lang.String msg)
        Allows for a user to input text into the prompt. This method returns once the enter key is pressed.
        Parameters:
        msg - The message to show to the user in the prompt. This message will be followed by a separator character, after which the editable part of the prompt will follow.
        Returns:
        A string containing the inputed text.

      • update

        public void update()
        Redraws all Components within the root container to a new frame, and then renders that frame to the screen.
        Specified by:
        update in interface ComponentObserver
